shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Introduction (fols. 1ra-16rb) - Mäqdǝmä wängel “Introduction to the Gospels” (fols. 1ra-13rb) - “Synopsis of Classes” (fols. 13va-14va) - Letter of Eusebius to Carpianus (fols. 15ra-16rb) - Canon tables (fols. 17r-20v) II) Gospel of Matthew (fols. 21r-90ra) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Matthew: 68 titles (fols. 21r-22r) - Opening line to the Gospel of Matthew (fol. 22r) - Bǝsratä Matewos “Gospel of Matthew” (fols. 25ra-89vb) - Postscript (fols. 89vb-90ra) III) Gospel of Mark (fols. 90rb-126rb) - Note containing the supposed language, place and date of origin followed by the statement about the Eusebian sections (fol. 90rb) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Mark: 48 titles (fols. 90v-91r) - Bǝsratä Marqos “Gospel of Mark” (fols. 92ra-126ra) - Postscript (fol. 126rb) IV) Gospel of Luke (fols. 126va-211va) - Opening line to the Gospel of Luke (fol. 126va) - Note containing the supposed language, place and date of origin followed by the statement about the Eusebian sections (fol. 126vb) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Luke: 83 titles (fols. 127r-128r) - Bǝsratä Luqas (fols. 129ra-211rb) - Postscript (fol. 211rb-va) V) Gospel of John (fols. 211vb-278rb) - Note containing the supposed language, place and date of origin followed by the statement about the Eusebian sections (fol. 211vb) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of John: 19 titles (fol. 212r) - Bǝsratä Yoḥannǝs “Gospel of John” (fols. 213ra-270rb, 271ra-278rb) - Postscript (fol. 270rb-va) - Note on some of the 72 disciples and note on the Episcopal Sees of the four Evangelists (fols. 270vb, 278r)
Additiones 1-3.

owners.owner: According to Additio 3, at a certain time the Ms. belonged to ʾabba Bä-Ḫaylä Śǝllus.

dcomments.dcomment: The year of mercy 7020 mentioned in Additio 1 may refer to the year of the production of the book.

txstates.txstate: The front board is missing. The leather cover is missing; remains of the turn-ins and the parchment inlays are visible on the inner side of the back board. The original sewing is missing. Most probably the Ms. has been resewn at least twice with the same thread: the first resewing (4 stations used) is preserved in quires I-IV and from quire XXXV onwards while the second resewing (2 stations used) is visible in quires VI-XXXIV. Also, the Ms. has been crudely repaired with stitches of vegetal origin and with leather stitches. Most of the quires are reinforced on the spine folds by parchment guards, attached to the quires by means of chains of leather strips. Some fols. are affected by water and damaged by rodents. The inner corners of the upper and lower margins are damaged. From fol. 29 onwards the damage results in a minor or greater loss of text. Fol. 270 is misplaced, it should follow fol. 278.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the front board is missing), remains of the dark brown tooled leather cover (turn-ins) and an overback (?) on the inner side of the back board. Remains of a parchment pastedown on the inner side of the back board. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the dark brown leather turn-ins (at least 1 tool was used: double line fillet).

bnothers.bnother: Most of the quires are reinforced with parchment guards, attached to the quires by means of side-stitches.

squires.squire:
I(8/fols. 1r-8v) – II(8/fols. 9r-16v) – III(8/fols. 17r-24v) – IV(8/fols. 25r-32v) – V(8/fols. 33r-40v) – VI(8/fols. 41r-48v) – VII(8/fols. 49r-56v) – VIII(8/fols. 57r-64v) – IX(8/fols. 65r-72v) – X(8/fols. 73r-80v) – XI(7; s.l.: 1, 2, loose leaves/fols. 81r-87v) – XII(12/fols. 88r-99v) – XIII(8/fols. 100r-107v) – XIV(4/fols. 108r-111v) – XV(4/fols. 112r-115v) – XVI(8/fols. 116r-123v) – XVII(4; s.l.: 1, no stub; 2, no stub/fols. 124r-127v) – XX(10/fols. 128r-137v) – XXI(7/fols. 138r-144v) – XXII(8/fols. 145r-152v) – XXIII(8/fols. 153r-160v) – XXIV(8/fols. 161r-168v) – XXV(8/fols. 169r-176v) – XXVI(8/fols. 177r-184v) – XXVII(8/fols. 185r-192v) – XXVIII(8/fols. 193r-200v) – XXIX(8/fols. 201r-208v) – XXX(4/fols. 209r-212v) – XXXI(8/fols. 213r-220v) – XXXII(8/fols. 221r-228v) – XXXIII(8/fols. 229r-236v) – XXXIV(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 237r-244v) – XXXV(8/fols. 245r-252v) – XXXVI(8/fols. 253r-260v) – XXXVII(9; s.l.: 9, no stub/fols. 261r-269v) – fol. 270 – XXXVIII(10-1/fols. 271r-279v).
The structure of quires cannot be exactly determined, esp. of quires XI, XVII, XXI, XXXVII, XXXVIII, because of the condition of the Ms. Fol. 270 (quire XXXVIII) is misplaced, it should follow fol. 278.

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible (close to the outer edge). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Selected features of the script: - tall, wide and broadly spaced letters - the body of several letters is triangular (e.g.: ዐ, ለ, መ) - the loops of መ are not separated - the writing of the vowel marker of the seventh order of ሎ is unstable: it may be attached directly to the body of the letter, without the connecting line (e.g., fol. 79vb l.13) or it may be attached through a connecting line (e.g., fol. 79vb l. 18, 28) - archaic form of ፩: triangular, upwards oriented (e.g., fol. 13rb l. 5), - archaic form of “four” (triangular, downwards oriented), (e.g., fol. 13rb l. ) - archaic form of “two” (e.g., fol. 13rb l. 2, 4) - form of “six”፮, looking like “compressed” numeral “seven”(e.g., fol. 13rb l.10).

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; a few lines (alternating with black lines) of the incipit of Texts I-V; a few lines of the incipit of the “Synopsis of Classes” and the “Letter of Eusebius to Carpianus”; the heading of the texts; the word mәʿәraf “chapter” and the number of the chapters; the number and the “tituli” of the chapters; the title of the sections of Mäqdǝmä wangel; the word qämär “table” followed by a numeral on fol. 13ra; referrences to the tables in the “Letter of Eusebius to Carpianus” on fol. 15rb-va; numbers of the “tituli”; elements of the Canon tables; the postscripts and the notes containing the supposed language, place and date of origin of the Gospels; the legends of the miniatures; the Chi-rho signs; the qwǝm-signs; elements of the punctuation signs; the Ethiopic numerals or their elements.

otherdetails.otherdetail:
- Details concerning types of postscripts included in the Gospels: I) Gospel of Matthew (fols. 21r-90ra) - Postscript containing stichometry (fol. 89vb) - Postscript containing the supposed language, place and date of origin (fol. 90ra) II) Gospel of Mark (fols. 90rb-126rb) - Postscript containing stichometry (fol. 126rb) - Postscript containing the supposed language, place and date of origin (fol. 126rb) III) Gospel of Luke (fols. 126va-211va) - Postscript containing stichometry (fol. 211rb) - Postscript containing the supposed language, place and date of origin (fol. 211va) IV) Gospel of John (fols. 211vb-278rb) - Postscript containing stichometry (fol. 270rb) - Postscript containing the supposed language, place and date of origin (fol. 270rb-va) - Note on some of the 72 disciples and note on the Episcopal Sees of the four Evangelists (fols. 270vb, 278r)
- Other signs used throughout the Ms.: zǝyyä-sign (fol. 26va l.16), qwǝm-sign (fol. 36rb l.20). - For the notes on some of the 72 disciples and the note on the Episcopal Sees of the four Evangelists s. R. ZUURMOND, Novum Testamentum Aethiopice: the Synoptic Gospels, Part I: General Introduction, Part II: Edition of the Gospel of Mark, Stuttgart, 1989 (AeF 27), p. 17. - The canon tables are distributed in 8 pages. The arches on fols. 20r and 20v have not been coloured. - The chapters are separated from each other with one blank line. - The numbers and “tituli” of the chapters are written in the upper margin, in red.

additional.cont: Fol. 14va-b: Inventory of the church property.
additional.det: The note is written in a mediocre hand, which is not very much posterior to that of the main text. The note mentions the date the year of mercy 7020 (= 1528 A.D.), 16 Ṭǝr, during the tenure of ʾabunä Täklä Näbiyat. It comprises of the list of paraphernalia, with their quantity, and the list of books (for some of them the title and the quantity are given).

additional.cont: Fol. 14vb: Qǝne-poem.
additional.det: The qǝne-poem is written in a mediocre hand. Above and below the poem the name of the type of the qǝne-poem, ʿǝṭanä mogär, has been written in a secondary hand.

additional.cont: Fol. 270va: Ownership note.
additional.add: Fol. 270va: ዝወንጌል፡ ዘአባ፡ በኃይ[ለ]፡ [ሥ]ሉስ፡ አቡሁ፡ በመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ለአባ፡ መርቆሬዎስ
additional.det: The note is written in a mediocre hand, probably later than the main text, which resembles (or is identical) to the hand of Additio 3. The second line is partly illegible. It states that the Ms. belongs to ʾabba Bä-Ḫaylä Śǝllus (a probable reconstruction of the name), the spiritual father of ʾabba Märqorewos.

extras.extra: - Two “tituli” for the Gospel of Mark have been completed in a small script, in a secondary hand: fol. 91r. - Numerous corrections written over erasures, in the main hand: fols. 3va, 5ra, 5vb, 9rb, 10rb,13rb, 13vb, 33ra, 37v, 58va, 60ra, 73v, 88vb, 89ra, 96ra, 97ra, 104rb, 107ra, 109va, 123ra, 124rb, 131va, 136r, 148vb, 159vb, 163va, 181ra, 182ra, 209rb, 228rb, 231rb, 234rb, 237va, 238ra, 239vb, 240ra, 256ra, 268ra. - Corrections written over erasures, in a secondary hand: fols. 143ra, - Erasures: fols. 25vb, 26rab, 224vb. - Part of the line of the “tituli” is taken up: fols. 21rv, 22r, 90v, 127rv, 128r, 212r. - Part of the line of the “tituli” is taken down: fols. 21rv, 22r, 90v, 91r, 127rv, 128r. - Scribbles, doodles: fols. 6v, 91r, 109ra, 211rb, 270va, 278v, 279r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Names of feasts or solemnities with the word ምንባብ “reading”, written in the upper margin indicate the beginning of the reading and written interlineally the end of the reading (often with the qwǝm-sign). They are written in red, most probably in a secondary hand contemporary to the main hand: Text II በመኃትወ፡ እፓንያ፡ ምንባብ: fol. 26va በሕጻናት፡ ምንባብ: fol. 27rb በስብከተ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ምንባብ: fol. 28rb ተዝካረ፡ አኃው፡ ወበኵሎሙ፡ ሰማዕ፡ ምንባብ: fol. 31ra በድራረ፡ ጾም፡ ምንባብ: 33ra [በቀ]ዳሚ[sic]፡ ሰንበተ፡ ጾም፡ ምንባብ: fol. 35ra በዳግሚት፡ ሰንበተ፡ ጾም፡ ምንባብ: fol. 36rb በሠሉስ፡ ዕለት፡ ዘሰንበተ፡ ሕማም፡ ምንባብ: fol. 36va በበዓለ፡ ፶፡ ምንባብ: fol. 39rb በጸሎተ: ሐዋርያት፡ ምንባብ: fol. 42rb በተዝካረ፡ ሰማዕት።: fol. 43rb በዮሐንስ፡ ዘሰንይ <…>: fol. 44vb በ፮፡ ሰንበተ፡ አይሁድ፡ ምንባብ: fol. 46rb በ፮፡ ሰንበተ፡ ወትር፡ ምንባብ: fol. 46va በ፫፡ ሰንበተ፡ አይሁድ፡ [ምንባብ] <…>: fol. 49va በአንስት፡ በሰንበት፡ እንተ፡ ቅድመ፡ ፶፡ ምንባብ: fol. 56rb በተዝካረ፡ ቅዳሴ፡ ወበእንተ፡ ክረምት፡ ምንባብ: fol. 58va በጸሎተ፡ ኤልያስ፡ ምንባብ: fol. 59va በ፫፡ ሰንበተ፡ <…> [ምን]ባብ: fol. 62vb በያዕቆብ <…> [ምንባብ]: fol. 66vb በበዓለ፡ ሆሳ[ዕና፡ ምንባብ]: fol. 67vb በተዝካረ፡ ነገሥት፡ ምንባብ: fol. 71va በጸሎተ፡ ዘካርያስ፡ ምንባብ: fol. 73vb በራብዕ፡ ሰንበተ፡ ጾም፡ ምንባብ: fol. 75vb በኃምስ፡ [ሰንበተ፡ ጾም፡ ምንባብ]: fol. 77vb በደናግል።: fol. 78ra በዓርብ፡ በ፫፡ ሰዓት፡ ምንባብ: fol. 85va በ፮፡ ሰዓት፡ በዓርብ፡ ምንባብ: fol. 86va በዓርብ፡ ሰ[sic]፱፡ ሰዓት፡ ምንባብ: fol. 87va ዓርብ፡ ሶበ፡ <…>: fol. 88rb Text III በሰንበተ፡ ዘሰዊት፡ ምንባብ: fol. 92rb በምትረተ፡ ርእሱ፡ ለዮሐንስ።: fol. 101va በረክብ፡ ምንባብ: fol. 102va በጸሎተ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት: fol. 109rb <…> ክሮ፡ አብ: fol. 114ra በያዕቆብ፡ ምንባብ: fol. 115rb በ፫፡ ሰዓተ፡ ሌሊት፡ ምንባብ: fol. 120va በ፮፡ ሰዓተ፡ ሌሊት፡ ምንባብ: fol. 121rb በ፱፡ ሰዓተ፡ ሌሊት፡ ምንባብ: fol. 122rb [በማር]ቆስ፡ ወንጌላዊ፡ ምንባብ: fol. 125va Text IV [በ፫፡ ሰንበተ፡ ቅድመ፡ ጌና፡] ምንባብ: fol. 129r በሰንበተ፡ ዘቅድመ፡ ጌና፡ ምንባብ: fol. 132va በሰንበተ፡ ቅድመ፡ ኤጴፋንያ፡ ምንባብ: fol. 136rb በጻድቃን፡ ወፂፍ: fol. 147rb በማኅበር፡ ምንባብ: fol. 163va በአባ፡ ገሪማ፡ ወበጰ[ንጠሌዎን፡] ወበአባ፡ ዮሐኒ፡ ምንባብ: fol. 173vb በሰንበተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ምንባብ: fol. 176rb [በጸሎ]ተ፡ ሐሙስ፡ ምንባብ: fol. 200ra በ፫፡ ሰዓተ፡ ሌሊት፡ ምንባብ: fol. 201rb በ፮፡ ሰዓተ፡ ሌሊት፡ ምንባብ: fol. 202rb [በ፱፡] ሰዓተ፡ ሌሊት፡ ምንባብ: fol. 203ra በጽባሕ፡ ዓርብ፡ ምንባብ: fol. 204ra በዐርብ፡ በ፫፡ ሰዓት፡ ምንባብ: fol. 205va በዐርብ፡ በ፮፡ ሰዓት፡ ምንባብ: fol. 206rb በዐርብ፡ በ፱፡ ሰዓት፡ ምንባብ: fol. 207rb በዐርብ፡ ሶበ፡ [የዐርብ፡ ፀሐይ፡ ምንባብ]: fol. 207vb በሳኒታ፡ በዓለ፡ ፋሲካ። ምንባብ: fol. 208rb በሳኒታ፡ በዓለ፡ ፋሲካ፡ ም: fol. 208vb በበዓለ፡ ፵ ምንባብ: fol. 2010rb Text V በእንድርያስ፡ ምንባብ።: fol. 215rb በእፓንያ፡ በሳኒታ፡ ምንባብ: fol. 216va በሳድስ፡ ሰንበተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ምንባብ: fol. 218rb በሰንበት፡ ዘድኀረ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ምንባብ: fol. 220ra በሐሙስ፡ ዕለት፡ ዘፋሲካ፡ ምንባብ: fol. 221ra በ፬፡ ሰንበት፡ ዘወትር፡ ምንባብ: fol. 224va በዓርብ፡ ዕለት፡ ዘፋሲካ፡ ምንባብ: fol. 229rb በሰንበተ፡ አይሁድድ[sic]፡ ዘፋሲካ፡ ምንባብ: fol. 231ra በጥልቀተ፡ በዓለ፡ ፋሲካ፡ በሰሙኑ፡ ምንባብ: fol. 234va በ፰፡ ሰንበት፡ ምንባብ: fol. 240va በጴጥሮስ።: fol. 243v በጸሎተ፡ መስቀል፡ ምንባብ: fol. 245ra በክፍት፡ ኀበ፡ ይትነብብ።: fol. 254va በጸሎተ፡ ኃሙስ፡ በክፍት፡ ምንባብ: fol. 256vb በ፳ወ፪፡ ለበዓለ፡ ፶፡ ምንባብ: fol. 258rb <…>ም፡ ምንባብ፡ በክፍት: fol. 259ra በሰንበት፡ ዘድኀረ፡ ፶፡ ሣልሳይ፡ ምንባብ: fol. 261va በ፲ወ፭፡ ለበዓለ፡ ፶፡ ምንባብ: fol. 263rb በበዓለ፡ አኰቴት፡ ኀበ፡ ይትነበብ።: fol. 263vb ሰርክ፡ በጸሎተ፡ ኃሙስ፡ ምንባብ: fol. 265va በ፫፡ ሰዓተ፡ ሌሊት፡ ምንባብ: fol. 266rb በ፮፡ ሰዓተ፡ ሌሊት፡ ምንባብ: fol. 266vb [በ፱፡] ሰዓተ፡ ሌሊት፡ ምንባብ: fol. 267ra በጽባሕ፡ ዓርብ፡ ምንባብ: fol. 267vb <…> ሰዓተ፡ <…> ምንባብ: fol. 269ra ዓርብ፡ በ<…>፡ ሰዓት፡ ምንባብ: fol. 271ra ዓርብ፡ በ፱፡ ሰዓት፡ ምንባብ: fol. 272rb በዓርብ፡ ሶበ፡ የዐርብ፡ ፀሐይ።: fol. 273ra በፋሲካ፡ በዕለተ፡ በዓል፡ ምንባብ: fol. 273va በሠሉስ፡ ዕለት፡ ዘፋሲካ፡ ኀበ፡ ይትነብብ።: fol. 275rb በረቡዕ፡ ዕለት፡ ዘፋሲካ፡ ምንባብ: fol. 276ra - A white thread is inserted in the upper margin of fol. 46, probably for navigation in the text. - Coloured threads are inserted in the right upper corner of fols. 79 (black), 82 (red), 133 (one red and one black), 176 (red), 212 (red and yellow), 218 (red and yellow), 273 (red), for navigation in the text.

miniature.info: Fol. 22v (above): St. Peter and St. Andrew.
miniature.details: Legends: ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ሐዋርያት። “Image of St. Peter the chief of the Apostles”, ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ እንድርያስ። “Image of St. Andrew”.

miniature.info: Fol. 22v (below): St. James the son of Zebedee and St. Philip.
miniature.details: Legends: ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ወልደ፡ ዘብዴዎስ። “Image of St. James the son of Zebedee”, ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፊልጶስ። “Image of St. Philip”.

miniature.info: Fol. 23r (above): St. Bartholomew and St. Thomas.
miniature.details: Legends: ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ በርተሎሜዎስ። “Image of St. Bartholomew, ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቶማስ። “Image of St. Thomas”.

miniature.info: Fol. 23r (below): St. Thaddaeus and St. Nathanael.
miniature.details: Legends: ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ታዴዎስ። “Image of St. Thaddaeus”, ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ናትናኤል። “Image of St. Nathanael”.

miniature.info: Fol. 23v (above): St. James the son of Alphaeus and St. Matthias.
miniature.details: Legends: ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ወልደ፡ እልፍየስ። “Image of St. James the son of Alphaeus, ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ማቲያስ። “Image of St. Matthias”.

miniature.info: Fol. 23v (below): St. Paul and St. James the brother of the Lord.
miniature.details: Legends: ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ጳውሎስ። “Image of St. Paul”, ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ እኁሁ፡ ለእግዚእነ(?)። “Image of St. James the brother of the Lord”.
Frontispiece miniature. Legend: ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ [ማ]ቴዎስ፡ ሐዋርያ፡ ወንጌላዊ። “Image of St. Matthew the Apostle [and] the Evangelist”.
Frontispiece miniature. The legend is missing due to the damage of the upper edge of the Ms.
Frontispiece miniature. Legend: ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ሐዋርያ፡ ወንጌላዊ። “Image of St. John the Apostle [and] the Evangelist”.

frames.frame: Fol. 1r (incipit of the Introduction): elaborate coloured (red, yellow, green, blue) ornamental band with three lateral extensions reaching the bottom of the page; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page; geometric motifs, interlaces. Fol. 13va (incipit of the “Synopsis of Classes”): elaborate coloured (red, yellow, green, blue) ornamental band; floral and zoomorphic motifs, interlaces. Fol. 15r (incipit of the Letter of Eusebius to Carpianus): elaborate coloured (red, yellow, green, blue) ornamental band with three short lateral extensions; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page; geometric and floral motifs, interlaces. Fol. 21r (incipit of the List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Matthew): unfinished elaborate ornamental band; interlaces. Fol. 25r (incipit of the Gospel of Matthew): elaborate coloured (red, yellow, green, blue) ornamental band with three lateral extensions reaching the bottom of the page; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page; geometric motifs, interlaces. Fol. 92r (incipit of the Gospel of Mark): elaborate coloured (red, yellow, green, blue) ornamental band with three short lateral extensions; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page; floral and geometric motifs, interlaces. Fol. 129r (incipit of the Gospel of Luke): elaborate coloured (red, yellow, green, blue) ornamental band with three lateral extensions running through the top half of the fol.; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page; floral and geometric motifs, interlaces. Fol. 213r (incipit of the Gospel of John): elaborate coloured (red, yellow, green, blue) ornamental band with three short lateral extensions; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page; floral and geometric motifs, interlaces.
